gaia::graphics::Region Class Reference

A Region represents a graphic area which might contains Rect or any shapes decribed by Path. More...

Detailed Description

A Region represents a graphic area which might contains Rect or any shapes decribed by Path. 

 // A rigion object comes from the union of rectangles
 Region rgn;
 rgn.set(&rect1);
 rgn.op(rect2, Region::UNION);
 rgn.op(rect3, Region::UNION);

 // Iterate the rects composing the above region
 RegionIterator iterator(rgn);
 Rect rects;
 while (iterator.next(&rects)) {
     canvas.drawRect(rects, paint);
 }

bool gaia::graphics::Region::equals ( const Region &  region) const

Compares this instance with the specified object and indicates if they are equal.

In order to be equal, o must represent the same object as this instance using a class-specific comparison. The general contract is that this comparison should be reflexive, symmetric, and transitive.

Parameters:
regionthe Region object to compare this instance with.
Returns:
true if the specified object is equal to this Object; false otherwise.
Path gaia::graphics::Region::getBoundaryPath ( ) const

Return the boundary of the region as a new Path.

If the region is empty, the path will also be empty.

bool gaia::graphics::Region::getBoundaryPath ( Path *  path) const

Set the path to the boundary of the region.

If the region is empty, the path will also empty.

Rect gaia::graphics::Region::getBounds ( ) const

Return a new Rect set to the bounds of the region.

If the region is empty, the Rect will be set to [0, 0, 0, 0]

Returns:
Rect the Rect will be set to [0, 0, 0, 0]

The assignment operator.

bool gaia::graphics::Region::quickContains ( const Rect &  r) const

Return true if the region is a single rectangle (not complex) and it contains the specified rectangle.

Returning false is not a guarantee that the rectangle is not contained by this region, but return true is a guarantee that the rectangle is contained by this region.

bool gaia::graphics::Region::quickContains ( int32_t  left,
int32_t  top,
int32_t  right,
int32_t  bottom 
) const

Return true if the region is a single rectangle (not complex) and it contains the specified rectangle.

Returning false is not a guarantee that the rectangle is not contained by this region, but return true is a guarantee that the rectangle is contained by this region.

bool gaia::graphics::Region::quickReject ( const Rect &  r)

Return true if the region is empty, or if the specified rectangle does not intersect the region.

Returning false is not a guarantee that they intersect, but returning true is a guarantee that they do not.

int32_t  top,
int32_t  right,
int32_t  bottom

Return true if the region is empty, or if the specified region does not intersect the region.

void gaia::graphics::Region::setEmpty ( )

Set the region to the empty region.

bool gaia::graphics::Region::setPath ( const Path &  path,
const Region &  clip 
)

Set the region to the area described by the path and clip.

Return true if the resulting region is non-empty. This produces a region that is identical to the pixels that would be drawn by the path (with no antialiasing).

void gaia::graphics::Region::translate ( int32_t  dx,
int32_t  dy 
)

Translate the region by [dx, dy].

If the region is empty, do nothing.

void gaia::graphics::Region::translate ( int32_t  dx,
int32_t  dy,
Region *  dst 
)

Set the dst region to the result of translating this region by [dx, dy].

If this region is empty, then dst will be set to empty.
